creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund, by exchange, and the Julia B. Bigelow Fund
description: interior scene at a maternity ward; a nurse in white stands at C, holding a swaddled baby stands between two rows of beds; various female figures and babies throughout, including a woman in the LL holding a bald child in white, a doctor sitting with a woman in green with her shirt pulled down and a baby in her lap at LC, children lying on beds in the UL background, a black woman holding a toddler and a baby in the LR, and two more women at RC, wrapping and attending to babies
markings: verso LRQ, two sheets of museum labels | verso LLQ, white printed gallery label: David Zwirner Gallery
text: Alice Neel has here depicted herself and second daughter Isabetta at a community health clinic in the Bronx, New York City. They can be seen in the center of the painting at far right. Neel’s first child died before the age of one just a year earlier and her anxiety and protective feelings for Isabetta surge throughout this psychologically charged interior.
title: Well Baby Clinic
